sources.title: Admiral Ushakov
sources.description:
A historical and biographical picture about the great Russian naval commander Fyodor Ushakov. 

The events of the film take place in 1785-1791 during the war with Turkey. Prince Potemkin, the favorite of Catherine II, entrusts the young Ushakov with the construction of ships. The Black Sea Fleet is created in the shortest possible time, despite the plague epidemic and fires, and Ushakov becomes a national hero. However, court intriguers manage to turn the empress against him with lies and denunciations.

IMDb: 7.3

Year of production: 1953

Director: Mikhail Romm 
Screenwriter: Alexander Stein 
Composer: Aram Khachaturian 
Cameramen: Alexander Shelenkov, Yolanda Chen 
Production designers: Shengelia Levan, Alexey Parkhomenko, Arnold Weisfeld 

Cast: Gennady Yudin, Ivan Pereverzev, Boris Livanov, Nikolay Svobodin, Nikolay Chistyakov, Vladimir Druzhnikov, Alexey Alekseev, Nikolay Volkov , Tumanov Vakhtang

metadata.Plot: Historical epic about the legendary Russian naval commander of the 18th century, admiral Fyodor Ushakov, and his fight for Crimea during the Russo-Turkish War.
metadata.Actors: Ivan Pereverzev, Boris Livanov, Sergey Bondarchuk
